title: Interaction-Based Social Studies Learning Design Through Online Learning Analytics

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience with online learning tools and understanding of fundamental social studies concepts
context.additional_context: Students learn social studies content with interactive elements by combining Zoom-based real-time classes and an LMS (Learning Management System). Learning engagement is assessed, and instructional design is improved through click behavior data analysis.

learning_goals: Learners can explore additional resources by utilizing hyperlinks, zoom buttons, expert advice links, etc., provided in online modules at over 80% frequency
Learners can dwell on each page for at least 120 seconds and achieve over 75% content comprehension
By scoring over 85% correct on formative assessments (multiple-choice items), learners can demonstrate effective learning engagement

resources: Learning analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, LMS-built-in analytics)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
